page.title: 10Sway.
page.content: Sway is taking part in the Best Kept Village Competition and has come 1st in its group - large villages in S.W. Hampshire. Situated on the edge of the New Forest, Sway is an attractive village, mainly residential in character, popular with retired people and young families. Over the last 15 years Sway has grown (current population 3200) as new housing estates, both council and private, have been built in former fields and large gardens. The estates are different in character, but are mostly pleasant houses with gardens. Most of the shops are in Station Road and include a Post Office, Newsagency, Greengrocer, Ironmonger, 3 Grocers shops, Hairdresser, 2 Dress shops, a Draper, a Chemist, a butcher, a wine shop and a photographer.
